definition: lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Maybe we know we are close to the end and we really push ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 也許是因爲火燒眉毛了就開始努力吧。

sentences.english: The situation in the Gulf of Mexico is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥灣的局勢火燒眉毛。

sentences.english: "Their hair is on fire, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “他們的情況已經火燒眉毛了，”利文斯說。

sentences.english: I just have no appetite for work until it becomes urgent.
sentences.chinese: 除非火燒眉毛了，否則我就是不想工作。
